title: Generate telemetry declarations and fix import path in useActor.ts

requirements.text: Run the terminal command 'dfx generate telemetry' (or platform equivalent) to generate TypeScript declarations for the telemetry canister

quotes: run the terminal command dfx generate telemetry (or your platform's equivalent) to build the TypeScript declarations

acceptanceCriteria: Telemetry canister declarations are generated successfully
TypeScript declaration files exist for the telemetry canister

requirements.text: Verify the actual folder structure for generated declarations and correct the import path in frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts from '../../../declarations/telemetry' to the correct relative path (likely '../../declarations/telemetry' if declarations are inside src)

quotes: frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts is currently importing from ../../../declarations/telemetry. If the declarations are actually located in ../../declarations/telemetry (inside src), fix the import path

acceptanceCriteria: Import path in useActor.ts correctly points to the generated telemetry declarations
No import path errors during build
The import resolves to the actual location of generated declarations

requirements.text: Trigger a rebuild after declarations are generated and import paths are verified
acceptanceCriteria: Build completes successfully without declaration-related errors
Frontend builds with correct telemetry actor imports

constraints: Do NOT modify dfx.json or any .mo files - backend is read-only for this request
Only verify that telemetry canister is registered in dfx.json - do not change it
Focus solely on declaration generation and path correction
nonGoals: Altering the dual-actor pattern in useActor.ts beyond fixing the import path
